title: Tour de France 2021 Standings after Stage 18
content:
General Classification / Yellow Jersey 

Despite a big mountain stage today, the top 3 in the General Classification stayed the same. Pogacar, Vingegaard and Carapaz proved themselves, once again, as the strongest three climbers in the race. It was a bad day for Rigoberto Uran, dropping down 6 places in to 10th spot. He'll be hoping to hold on to a top 10 position by the time the Tour reaches Paris.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Jonas Vingegaard +5:39
3. Richard Carapaz +5:43
4. Ben O'Connor +8:18
5. Wilco Kelderman +8:50
6. Enric Mas +10:11
7. Alexey Lutsenko +11:22
8. Guillaume Martin +12:46
9. Pello Bilbao +13:48
10. Rigoberto Uran +16:25

Tour de France 2021 Guide

Points Classification / Green Jersey

Mark Cavendish extends his lead in the Points Classification after finishing ahead of his closest rival, Michael Matthews, in today's intermediate sprint, following a textbook leadout from his Quick - Step teammates.

1. Mark Cavendish - 298 points
2. Michael Matthews - 260 points
3. Sonny Colbrelli - 208 points
4. Jasper Philipsen - 184 points
5. Julian Alaphilippe - 155 points

The Tour de France jerseys – the race so far

King of the Mountains Classification / Polka-Dot Jersey

After his stage win today, Tadej Pogacar moves ahead of Wout Poels in this classification, making the Polka Dot jersey the third competition he's leading in the race. Although Pogacar now leads, Poels will continue to wear the jersey on behalf of the Slovenian.

1. Tadej Pogacar - 107 points
2. Wout Poels - 88 points
3. Jonas Vingegaard - 82 points
4. Michael Woods - 72 points
5. Wout van Aert - 68 points

Young Rider's Classification / White Jersey

The top three contenders in the fight for the White Jersey stayed the same today.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Jonas Vingegaard +5:45
3. David Gaudu +18:42

 Team Classification

1. Bahrain Victorious
2. EF Education-Nippo +34:16
3. AG2R Citroen +50:26
4. Trek Segafredo +51:16
5. Team Jumbo Visma +55:45
